message.content:
In LibreOffice Calc, you can use the CONCATENATE function (which is the same as Excel's =CONCATENATE function) combined with the SUBSTITUTE function, to perform this task.

The formula would look like this:

```
=SUBSTITUTE(CONCATENATE("'",A1,"'"),"''","")
```

In this formula, replace "A1" in the CONCATENATE function with the reference of the cell whose contents you want to copy and remove all single quotes from. 

Also note that this will not work if the string being quoted contains other quotes (as is common when dealing with Excel). In such cases, you may need a different approach (e.g., using a scripting language like Python or JavaScript) in order to achieve your desired outcome.
